We then checked in at the front desk where we were also greeted with a cordial, "Happy Anniversary!" and the same concierge guy proceeded to come over with a red rose for me.... UHMMM... have I just arrived at Disneyland where they all greet you with a "Happy Birthday!" because of the birthday pin you're wearing?!???!? NO! But we certainly have arrived at Hotel 1000 that made me feel like the happiest girl in the worldddd!! Upon entering our Grand Luxe Parlor Suite with a view of Downtown Seattle (gorgeous and worth every penny in every single square inch of that 575 square foot room!), I was surprisingly stunned and even more ecstatic to find red rose petals intricately placed all over the lovely king sized bed, a bottle of champagne, strawberries, and a letter from the hotel addressed to "Mr. and Mrs." AHHHHHH... SO I HAVE ENTERED THE HAPPIEST PLACE IN THE WORLD! Not to mention, though my boyfriend did surprise me with the upgrade of the suite, the hotel surprised the both of us with all of these things being COMPLIMENTARY! HAPPY ANNIVERSARY TO US!!!! Okay. Overall, hands down, out of the 2 days we were in Seattle, 3/4 of our trip was spent in our beautiful hotel suite...trust me, you won't want to leave.......! Oh yeah, and that bathtub that everybody has so many good things to say about.....believe what you read, it's ALL TRUE. It's definitely one sexyass tub, totally fits two people ;] The whole clean, sleek, modern feel of Hotel 1000 + their hotel bar/restaurant, Boka, combined with top of the line customer service all around--that makes your experience in Seattle truly feel like Disneyland--is why YOU need to book your anniversary/birthday/getaway/random trip here at this hotel. I'm telling you, I left feeling like I was at the happiest place in the world. The experience was beyond magical. Hotel 1000, I'm in love.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, with maybe some service issues”
Reviews.Author: Chistery
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights at the Hotel 1000. Thanks to Amex FHR I was upgraded to a suite, which whilst it had no view, was very nice. The room has some nice features, such as an audio cable to plug your mp3 player into the TV. A lot of hotels now provide you the ability to connect your music or laptop to the TV, but never give you the cables, and who carries one with them? There was also an ipod cable so you could connect that or charge it if needed. It's about the only hotel I've stayed in where the HD TV displays everything in the right format. There is some style over substance. The bath that fills from the ceiling may look nice, but in reality it splashes water everywhere, and the water had to be on full to get it hot. It's then almost impossible to top up the bath later on. The hotel is in a great location, a few blocks from the University Street station if you come in via the Light Rail, just head for the 2nd Ave exit. Ordered a continental breakfast on my first day, and all I got was a yoghurt muesli thing. The tray came with jams and butter, but a bit pointless with no pastries or croissants to have them with. Wasn't sure if I'd made a mistake on the card or not, but didn't seem much of a continental breakfast. The breakfast card also wasn't replaced so hard to re-order the next day. I decided on breakfast in the restaurant after that, and one time was seated then ignored, a coffee came with no spoon or sugar, but no issues the other times. All the staff I did interact with, seemed to be genuinely happy and interested. Overall, the hotel has a very good hard product, and except for a few issues with the soft product, I had a very enjoyable stay. I would stay again if I go back to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “biggest disappointment, lots of hype no service”
Reviews.Author: newlyweds41
Reviews.Content: We booked this for hotel for our honeymoon. When we arrived we were not given the room we booked online. They told us they could not do anything for us. The room must have been the smallest in the hotel. My new bride was left crying in the lobby while we left the hotel to find another place to stay at the last minute. For a hotel that is rated the one of the best in Seattle we were thoroughly disappointed with their service, their unwillingness to provide an alternative solution especially when it was the very first night of our honeymoon. I have managed a restaurant for 5 years. If I treated my customers the way this hotel treated us I wouldn't have a business. Extremely disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: 58595Annie
Reviews.Content: The view was great, the room was wonderful and everyone was so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected, memorable delight”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob98
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler, for business and for leisure and typically only stay in 4 or 5 star hotels. When I found out I had to go to Seattle for business last month, I was ambivalent regarding where I was staying, as I had visited most of the luxury hotels on prior trips and had been underwhelmed by my experiences. A relative suggested I try Hotel 1000. I could not have been more pleasantly surprised. When I arrived to the hotel, I immediately felt welcome. The person who checked me in was genuine and seemed happy to be there. The room was spacious and bright. My room had a great view of the water. Furnishings were extremely comfortable and practical. The technology was of-the-moment. Every staff member I encountered during my stay was smiling, helpful and professional. I had a late night dinner in the restaurant one night, at the bar. The atmosphere was bustling yet not too trendy and the food was innovative and flavorful. One hidden treasure I didn't know they had but discovered was the Golf Club. What a cool spot! I played some holes at Pebble Beach with a friend and we ordered some beers and snacks - it was great for a rainy night when we didn't feel like leaving. The location of the hotel is perfect. One rainy night I was going out to meet a client and the valet offered to drive me in their house car. Ben (I believe that was his name), the driver, was engaging and courteous. You can walk to restaurants, the water is close by and the Fish Market is a 10 minute stroll. Next time I visit Seattle, I will look forward to coming back to Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: be01057
Reviews.Content: This review is probably long overdue. I travel to Seattle several times/year and I always stay at Hotel 1000. I just completed my 16th stay there over the past two years. The rooms are modern, spacious, always clean and extremely comfortable. In addition, the staff is FANTASTIC. They always greet me by name whenever I arrive, make sure I'm in the best room available, and they reward their repeat customers with some nice perks (free goodies in the room, upgrades, etc). Also, they have a great restaurant attached to the hotel (which translates to good room service - always important). Usually, when you go to one hotel a bunch of times, you're bound to have a bad experience eventually. So far, Hotel 1000 has not disappointed. It's not the cheapest option in town, but I'd definitely recommend it for business or leisure to anyone willing to spend a little $. You'll get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location, Excellent Food”
Reviews.Author: Zyosia
Reviews.Content: My husband and travel regularly to the Hotel 1000, mostly for fun in Seattle. I have never been disappointed with my stays. The front desk staff always acknowledges us by name, the service is wonderful, the rooms are spotless, and the food is fresh and delicious. I never hesitate to recommend the Hotel 1000 to all of my friends as well as my colleagues in the industry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaylinf
Reviews.Content: Staff and Amenities are 5 star quality. I will be staying at Hotel 1000 on my next trip up to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: leslieciminello
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this chic boutique hotel over 85 times, and every time I walk in the front door I instantly feel at home. I travel for work, and to me it was more important to find a place that makes me feel at home every time I am on the road, even if it means forgoing hotel rewards. I have food allergies, and the because the Hotel 1000 is like family to me they go out of their way to make sure I always have special food every time I arrive. The fitness facility is better than most chain hotels, and for a boutique hotel that is pretty impressive. I have used the spa several times, and each time I do I manage to forget everything about work for 90 minutes. The property is set up very well for business or weekend travel. You can walk to Belltown, Pike's Market, or downtown, and the Hotel 1000 will even drive you to your destination in their black Cadillac sedan if you are headed somewhere close by. I can't say enough about this spot. I have honestly given up thousands of hotel rewards points, because to me nothing else compares to feeling like your staying with friends every time you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: mncapitalist
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Seattle. Good location, nice rooms, great beds, very clean. Wonderful service. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: TEEVEE
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay from start to finish! The room was large and very comfortable. Open bath with water from the ceiling and view to the TV was the perfect place to relax after a wonderful massage at the hotel's spa. Every staff member was warm, friendly & helpful. Even had complimentary overnight shoe shine and I had 2 pair come back looking brand new. Restaurant in lobby had a good breakfast and the relaxing "fireplace" lounge in lobby was an ideal spot for a quiet glass of wine in the evening. Easy wireless connections for computers, great storage space in the room. Large separate shower in the modern bath. Location is a bit of a walk from the center of downtown - but it's not difficult. Exceptional service even continued when I check out and the valet brought the rental car around where I found cold water bottles in each cupholder and a note thanking me for my stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: paulhempstock
Reviews.Content: Rooms and public areas are very nice and superclean - gym was pretty good and modern. I had a room facing the back, which means a view of a concrete wall - get one at the front if you can. I did not rate the restaurant very highly - in Seattle coffee needs to be better than that! Free WiFi was great and worked in every part of the hotel with high bandwidth.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: auroradreaming
Reviews.Content: I went Seattle on a business trip but since it had been awhile since I traveled to that city, I wanted to be a tourist too. Great location, awesome service, valet, housekeeping outstanding! Got a last minute special which made the stay soooo much better.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: peteNrete
Reviews.Content: Thankyou to all the staff at Hotel 1000 for making the 3 nights we stayed there on our Honeymoon a most enjoyable experience. Check in was quick, friendly and personable without being stuffy like a lot of hotels, the glass of champagne on arrival was a nice touch. The room was a very good size and immaculate, and housekeeping did a great job keeping it that way. We got a call from guest services shortly after settling in asking us if everything was ok, i told her everything was perfect, including the lovely chocolate covered strawberries and bottle of champagne and the card congratulating us on our marriage, thankyou again. The complimentry use of the Hotel Cadillac for trips downtown and back was fatastic, thanks Jordan for a great job. The Boka restaurant is a great place for a meal or just a drink at the bar, the meals were very good and very reasonably priced, as was breakfast. All in all the Hotel 1000 is a great place to stay, with friendly staff great rooms and good food, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best.”
Reviews.Author: monmouthspring
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel1000 is wonderful. The best. Combine an outstanding staff with a fabulous facility and it makes for a great stay. The rooms are extremely well designed. Tubs fill from the ceiling!!!. Room lighting is amazing. The beds are beyond comfortable. DId I mention beautiful? The rooms are stunning. While the location is central to the market, shopping, great restaurants, etc., the stay at the hotel is a vacation in and of itself. Give yourself more than a weekend if you can because we just didn't have time to take advantage of all this hotel has to offer. I would also reserve well in advance to make sure you can get a room. They were fully booked when we were there last weekend. Highly recommended. Best in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and courteous”
Reviews.Author: starsstuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room with two double beds on the top floor. I don't know what I liked best, the luxurious bed, the fabulous bathtub, or the stellar view. The contemporary decorating is soothing and the room was spotlessly clean. On top of that it had the quietest heating/ventilation system of any hotel room I've ever stayed in. Unfortunately, it IS downtown Seattle and there was a big football game that night. The noise from the street was still loud 14 floors up. The staff was very friendly and courteous, from the desk clerks, to the restaurant staff and valet attendants. Hope to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in service”
Reviews.Author: southwrdbound5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1000 for two nights in September. The decor was modern and nice, but the service was poor . When we asked for a small refrigerator to be delivered to our room the first day, it was not delivered to the next day. When we got back to our room after being gone all day our room was not cleaned. We were short on towels through out the stay even thought we were charged an additional $30 for the third person in our room. There are so many other options for hotels in Seattle. I would not return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VegasLiz80
Reviews.Content: I cannot imagine what the other reviewers found wrong with this hotel...it was perfect. We arrived before noon and were quickly put in our room. The room was beautiful and very modern. The beds are so comfy. The room is designed for the utmost in comfort. The desk clerks were super efficient. It was our anniversay and my birthday. Soon after arriving, the cutest little cupcakes were brought to our room. And by the way, they were delicious! The hotel has a Cadillac that you can snag for a quick drop-off anywhere in the downtown area. We asked for a ride twice to the Pikes market and once, when the car was not available, the concierge got a taxi voucher for us and the hotel paid for our taxi ride! The Boka cafe is also a great place to eat. We ate dinner and breakfast there. We stayed at this hotel the night before and a night after our Alaskan cruise. We were treated so kindly by all staff. The hotel has thought of everything to make you comfortable. If you are unsure of whether to stay here or not, trust me when I say you will be thrilled with your choice. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great, fun rooms, friendly, helpful staff - convenient but So-So location, cold public areas.”
Reviews.Author: jgootz
Reviews.Content: Romantics and technophobes will love the trendy rooms. Ours had a great bath with a huge glass window to the room (and a partial view of the waterfront and sunsets), 2 person tub with filler from the ceiling above, et'c. plus room had a large screen TV that could connect you with the world! Don't miss the pizza at Serious Pie or the incredible spumoni with pistchios and cherry sauce for dessert (I'm salivating just remembering it).

Reviews.Title: “nice, but expected more”
Reviews.Author: micheleweston
Reviews.Content: the hotel is well maintained, clean, great service from the staff. The location was good, the view is of a brick building unless you are one of the lucky ones and get a water view (we tried--did not get one). There is no pool, no access to the rooftop garden (this is for the top 10 floor condo owners), no balcony from the room. The size of the room was adequate and the decoration was quite nice. We enjoyed Starbucks coffee every morning in the front room overlooking First Avenue watching the world go by--very enjoyable. The room has a French press and Starbucks coffee, an electric kettle and Tazo tea. The bathroom was upscale and enjoyable. The staff had to be called as some rowdy guests were very loud at 2 a.m. This was the first hotel stay that I have experienced where our call was immediately handle and resolved and the guests were quiet after being warned. Great going, Staff--very much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “NOT that good!”
Reviews.Author: toyBeirut
Reviews.Content: I was quite dissaponted with my stay there. Not that it was good, but there really wasn't anything special about it... Our room was on the 11th floor, there are 12 flloors I think, it was a corner suite, but even that high, the view is nothing extraordinary. Most of it gives on an offices building. Location is ...ok... not in the center of the action, but not too far either. It's around 10-15 minutes to the market... The concierge was quite nice, but if you need some advice late in the afternoon forget it! There is only one concierge, so passed his shift no one will come to replace him! The room is nice, the bathroom is very nice, no complaints here. You pay a palace price for an ok hotel. You just need to know that.

Reviews.Title: “A nice choice for a Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCW34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay someplace different from our usual haunts for our weekenders to Seattle. We chose the 1000 based on a friend's recommendation, and it turned out to be a great choice. The hotel is all first class, from the staff to the accommodations. A bit on the high end for price, but a wonderful stay. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very high tec trendy, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ji1731
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in downtown Seattle near the waterfront. Very modern with lots of high tech features. Rooms are somewhat small. Great service with a very well trained staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0517
Reviews.Content: We had to rebook our trip from a July vacation to an August vacation. We had booked the Inn at the Market but when we tried to rebook for August there was "no room at the inn". I decied to give the Hotel 100 a try and we are very glad we did. Locatoin for us was great. Right where we wanted to be. Within an easy walk to Pike Market and other great Seattle attractions. Room was great. The open window to the bath gave it a great open feel. Loved the tub with the fill from the ceiling mode. The shower was on the small side and we are not "big" people. Staff was warm and welcoming. It is a very up scale looking hotel. The buffet breakfast in the Boca restaurant was very adequate for us. It's a very "hip" hotel and I am sure it will appeal to a lot of travelers both on business and on pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING EXPERIENCE AT THE SPAAHH!!!”
Reviews.Author: bgregg7
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Hotel 1000 and their Spaahh to everyone! The valet and concierge service was extremely helpful and nice. This was my first time at the hotel so I wasn't sure where to go from the concierge desk, but once I told them I had an appointment at the spa, without hesitation they personally walked me there. Just stepping foot inside the Spaahh changed my mood and immediately relaxed me. From the complimentary fruit and drinks while you waited, to the actual Spaahh treatment, I was very impressed! I had a waxing done, so not the most pleasant of things but Nita was great and I hardly felt a thing! I'm very hesitant about where I go for my waxing and now that I've found the Spaahh I won't go anywhere else! Thank you Hotel 1000 and the Spaahh for your above and beyond customer service and the amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, room, and "green"”
Reviews.Author: Cattledogs
Reviews.Content: Although it was not right at the market or Seattle Center, it was the easy walking distance. Pioneer Square was just a few blocks away and we got to see the streets being blocked off for President Obama's arrival. It is also very close to Argosy tour and Seattle Aquarium. Service was superb, and the rooms (we had two) were clean and relaxing. And the famous bathroom! One of our rooms only had the shower but the shower was great as well. I particularly like the fact that the shampoo, conditioner, etc were in the big dispensers so that we do not have to use small plastic bottles that are tossed after the use. I loved the smell of those products that were not overpowering. Also the iced tea at the lobby added the great touch! There are so many restaurants around. We definitely would come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: surrideo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and will return when next in Seattle. From arrival to departure we found every member of staff we encountered helpful, efficient and friendly. They are a credit to the hotel and mark it apart - our impression was that everyone we met made an effort to ensure our stay and our visit to the city were enjoyable. Our room was furnished well, in very good condition and very clean. The design was modern and finishing touches, such as a cafetiere and molton brown toiletries, were nice additions. We found the beds very comfortable and we were not disturbed by noise. The bathroom was a good size with both a freestanding bath and a separate shower cubicle. The hotel's food was good and the spa offered a range of treatments. Hotel 1000 is ideally located for a leisure visit. For example, it is a walk from Pioneer Square, the waterfront, Seattle Art Museum and Pike Place Market. Qwest and Safeco fields are nearby. We didn't find it difficult to get to places further away that we wanted to visit. We agreed that this was one of the best stays in a hotel of this class we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: LynneJSM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in downtown Seattle -- short walk to Pike Place Market, shopping and restaurants. Staff was very friendly. Contemporary rooms with plenty of closet space. Cool bathroom -- with bathtub that fills from the ceiling. Rooms could use better lighting. There were a few design flaws (for example, bathroom sink was attractive, but splashed water everywhere), but overall a great hotel. If using valet parking, allow extra time -- retrieving the car was a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the average person”
Reviews.Author: jts98116
Reviews.Content: Got this stay as a gift. Never even heard about this hotel. I normally don't stay in hotels like this. I guess when you don't stay at a place like this(luxury hotel), you don't know what to expect. At first everything seemed all right but how fast you can feel like no body. We checked in early 1:30ish. They stated room not ready so they could take our bags and then they will call us when ready(4pm is guarantee). We were tired but they had a resturant so we went for lunch(not a variety of choices). Instead of working on 70 wines, work on the menu? Just a suggestion We finished lunch about 3ish(service is slow but we didn't care since rooms still not ready). We came back and room still not ready. Said in 30 miniutes. As we waited, 3 - 6 couples checked in. They were all offered Champagne and choice of newspaper. Which we were not offered. We waited after 4pm. We get a call stating our room was ready. We told them we were waiting in the lobby. Within a miniute, someone comes by to ask us if we were helped. He checked and stated our room was almost ready. At this point I really did not want to stay. I could care less but to see my wife, seeing everyone treated like royalty and us treated as no one,made me sick. This is the reason I don't stay in places like this. This was our anniversity and it was nice of them with the plate design left in the room but does anything seem worth while when your first impression is shoot?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...cool place....”
Reviews.Author: dawgrules
Reviews.Content: I am not usually the type to stay in this nice of hotel, but through my work status, I was able to get a great price on this hotel for about 4 nights. Great place, check-in was awesome, room was awesome, bar/restaurant was awesome, sitting room was awesome. I do travel about one-two weeks a month and I must say this is the coolest hotel I have ever stayed in. I am not sure I would have paid the full price, but if I ever get a chance to bring my family; we are staying here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: attytrav.
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 1210 for 3 nights. great room, loved the french press coffee maker and large bathtub. nice view of the harbor. staff were extremely accommodating, including providing a glass of champagne at check in. Our conference had several meals at the hotel, assume came from Boka and the food was fantastic. I appreciated that they did not produce the garbage that most hotels provide to large groups but seem to provide the same food that one would get in the restaurant. Easy to walk to most things. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Jodyts
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about this fabulous hotel. I am a very particular traveler, and have stayed in some of the most spectacular and luxurious hotels across the globe... Hotel 1000 is right at the top of my list as one of my favorites. From the moment you step out of your car and are greeted by their fabulous valet staff, you know you've arrived at somewhere special. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful - even offering cold champagne at check in. The rooms are so technologically advanced, it's amazing! I cannot say enough about the "H1K'. If you get a chance to stay here, don't pass it by. You will NOT be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing night!”
Reviews.Author: superstef02
Reviews.Content: I came to the Hotel 1000 with my cousin on the night before her wedding. all the bridesmaids stayed together at the hotel and we had such an amazing night! The staff had left champagne and a cake decorated with a personalized message in the room for us. We went down to happy hour at BOKA and had the truffle fries--amazing, fondue tater tots--fantastic and my favorite, the macaroni and cheese. The staff was wonderful to us our whole stay and I think really made the event special for my cousin. I definitely recommend this hotel for special occasions and any other time you want to be pampered away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Business”
Reviews.Author: kaylinf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 1000 for a business meeting, in from LA. What a great staff. They met all my expectations. Very welcoming team and maked me feel like home. It is nice and quite after a long day of meetings. The hotel room is very zen and clean. I will definitely come back to Hotel 1000 when i am back in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: gwright06_22
Reviews.Content: We called and asked them if they had a room we could rent for a party. We made sure it was ok to have a party. They gave us a room at the end of a hall and assured us it would be fine, so we booked the room. We showed up to the hotes and everything was fine, but as soon as we paid for the room there attitude fliped one hundred eighty degrees. They were extremely rood to us, they showed up to the room and threw us out with no refund. We where not allowed to speak to managment. I could not bealieve how we were treated, like we were children. Not Permited to speak to managment. What kind of hotel takes money from a guest and doesn't allow them to discuss a complaint with managment. They through us out on the street and where extremely rood and mean to us. We had to leave and had no where else to go. I will never stay in this over prices crappy hotel with horrible service again.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshort032
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to when we left two days later it was pure pleasure. The staff was outstanding. The food in their restaurant was nothing short of excellence. We had a corner suite in the front of the hotel. It was spotless, well appointed and comfortable. Was it a bargain?......probably not, but if I went back to Seattle I would stay there again. We stayed two nights prior to a cruise to Alaska. I booked on the internet after communicating with the staff about our trip. We opted for the package that included breakfast, transportation to the pier and a city pass that gave us a coupon book containing free admission to the zoo and aquarium, which we very much wanted to go to and did. Both were well worth the effort. The staff made recommendations for Dinner both nights we were there and based on our preferences, they couldn't have made better suggestions. They even drove us to the restaurant in the hotel car. The Hotel and their staff will be a part of our memories of Seattle. By the way, we loved the City and we aren't city folk. Very pedestrian friendly...lots to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY MUST STAY HERE! AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenjujubee
Reviews.Content: OK..... We are very picky when it comes to travel...HOTEL 1000 in Seattle was OUTSTANDING in EVERYWAY! We are totally into Design, Style, Customer Service, Location..... honestly...look no more! THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY!!! 5 blocks from Pike's Market...2 blocks from the Ferry Building

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Candiedshell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I so enjoyed our stay! Our room was amazing!!! The staff was superb and the cocktail lounge downstairs, devine! I have not one complaint or criticism regarding this property... if you are looking for a great Seattle experience you simply MUST stay at Hotel 1000!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZtravels_10
Reviews.Content: One of the absolute best hotels for the money I have ever stayed in. Great location downtown close to all the usual Seattle attractions, but this hotel stands out. The staff, the restaurant on site is fantastic, and the rooms are superb. Give this place a try if you are in Seattle on business or pleasure. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further!”
Reviews.Author: CaroBru
Reviews.Content: So glad 1st choice was full because we then stumbled on Hotel 1000. It is a 4 year old jewel in a perfectly convenient location. Excellent in all categories. Courtesy car/driver saved many cab trips for only the cost of a gratuity. Same car took us to the airport for $40, which is a deal in Seattle! Miles is a superb concierge! Listen to his suggestions! Yummy breakfast in hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: TimfromLondon
Reviews.Content: On a 2 day business trip from Europe, this designer-hotel was a very comfortable place to wrestle with jet lag. The room and open bathroom were large and up to the minute (with Moultton Brown toiletries) and included some stylish detail including a funky bath filled from the ceiling. Service was impeccable and this was so much better than the other soulless hotels I've stayed at in Seattle. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: amazon100
Reviews.Content: One word-disappointing! Our group was excited to stay here but we had problems from start to finish. We heard apologies, excuses and no resolution except for a free breakfast that our company will pay for. We will not stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We made the perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: azjen5
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 was the perfect setting for our end of vacation, 4th of July celebration. We were in a Grand Luxe water view suite on the 9th floor-a corner room with stunning views, even in the rain. We've traveled quite a bit, so it's hard to live up to my expectations, even for a luxury hotel, but this one did. Unfortunately, we were only there one night and less than a day, so we didn't get to try out the spa or restaurant. The front desk staff and concierge were excellent and gave us wonderful recommendations, the room had many fun, modern touches, and the location was perfect for what we were looking for. And the relaxation channel playing when we got in for the evening was the perfect bedtime story. Can't wait to come back for a longer visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: scarletpaisley
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one-night stay at the Hotel 1000 for our anniversary trip to Seattle. They left us cupcakes in our room with "Happy Anniversary, Mr and Mrs..." on it, which was adorable! Our view from the top floor of the hotel was fantastic. We loved the bathroom- having the toilet separate from the rest of the bath makes the room much more usable. And the tub was lovely! We also appreciated the free WiFi so we could find our way around with my Itouch. The location was nice, close to the waterfront and a short walk to Pikes Place. It was a longer walk to Seattle Center, however. We came by Lite rail from the airport which was SO cheap and easy- we got off at the University St station. The only negative was that we arrived quite early- around 11:30am. We were allowed to store our bags so we could explore the city and told they would try to get the room cleaned up quickly- to check back in 2 hours. It ended up being 4 hours before we could get into our room, and even then they were still restocking the mini bar. We realized we were early, but would have appreciated an honest estimate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely beds!”
Reviews.Author: LondonSarah1234
Reviews.Content: Handy for the art institute and ferries, and only a few minutes from Pike Place Market. We had a view of Puget Sound so it was lovely to lie on the very comfortable bed and see the sun shimmering on the water. As shown in others' photos, the bathrooms are great. There is a shop called "Taboo Video" right next door but it's not exactly shocking: it made us laugh to see it next to a classy hotel. The discount voucher we got with our Savor Seattle tour got us 10% off in the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to Seattle, call ahead and stay HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Alaskan31020
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 staff members were excellent from communicating long distance before we left home to when we left the hotel after we extended our stay! Very nice warm, comfortable room. Well appointed with a very nice bath tub! I wanted to have some special items in the room without having to run all over town and the concierge service took care of it nicely. We enjoyed the food very much! The eggs Benedict was the best I'd had! A hard room to leave! A 1000 thanks to the Hotel 1000!

Reviews.Title: “My 4th July waaaaaaaw”
Reviews.Author: susannian
Reviews.Content: We had a great time with M & m towncar and limo service, Thanks for being on time and taking care of all of us. I know wel drunk, but your driver was very proffesional in handling us. Thanks we will use you again.....‎

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Dave8001
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a better start to our vacation. The hotel has wonderful decor. The rooms are beautiful, and the staff are extremely attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Probably overrated, but I would still recommend”
Reviews.Author: HnYMnR
Reviews.Content: Given the price and popularity on TA, I had high expectations for this place. Don't get me wrong it's a great hotel and great location but it's obviously not "Seattle’s Premiere Luxury Hotel Destination" as their website purports. The shower had some mold, the wall paper was peeling in some places, and the curtains in the room were half broken. Really not a big deal. The thing that didn't meet my expectations was the service. The front desk never explained the amenities of the hotel, we weren't greeted in the lobby by name or otherwise, the bell boys seemed uninterested in greeting or helping at all. Not sure why Hotel 1000 think it can be considered "Seattle’s Premiere Luxury Hotel Destination" with these kind of obvious issues. Although I am focusing on the negitive stuff here, the hotel was nice and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: leadsimply
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 may have reinvented how the hotel experience should be. They have designed everything to make the guest experience exceptional. Most impressive was the empowered staff who seemed to anticipate anything you might need. Highly engaging and every player could help in and outside of their role.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a queen”
Reviews.Author: Denised69
Reviews.Content: When I got to my room, there was water and cookies with a welcome postcard. The view is beautiful. The big soaking bathtub was great after walking all around Seattle.....be careful the water comes from the ceiling!! The queen sized bed was VERY comfy. The staff is really friendly and willing to help with anything you need. They also have a courtesy car (I think a Lincoln) to drive you where you'd like to go, that is on a first come first serve basis. Every night they come to your room remove that fancy pillows and prepare your bed for sleeping, they also pull the shades and leave candy. I would recommend this Hotel. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “I want to stay at Hotel 1000 again and again and again and again”
Reviews.Author: neonnspurs
Reviews.Content: "INEFFABLE ... incapable of being expressed in words ... but I will try. Hotel 1000 exceeded my expectations in almost every way. I could barely drag myself from the tub to go to my meetings ... it is a high maintenance girl's dream. I also treated myself to a facial at the Spa. I usually have very low expectations for this "on the road" experience as the staff knows that it is unlikely they will see you again. Nita treated me as if I had been her client for years. She provided me with excellent skin education and gave me a facial so good that I will come back to Hotel 1000 on a regular basis just to indulge in her care. The food was fabulous, the decor elegant and edgy, the staff professional yet kind. I am counting the days until my next stay ...

Reviews.Title: “Seattle was great but the hotel was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: HayKay
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel you want to keep to yourself. Incredibly well located. Just take Madison and walk a couple of blocks downhill from the hotel and you're right at Ivars on the waterfront with all the other great seafood bars and restaurants on the piers. Turn right coming out of the hotel lobby, walk along First Ave and you'll come across lots of great little shops (including a wine shop to pick up some great Washington wines), the Seattle Art Museum and the famous Pike Place Market. At the hotel, the staff welcomes you with open arms as soon as you walk in the door. And the room! We didn,t want to leave the room! Very modern and spacious. King-sized bed was extremely comfortable with great lighting for reading and an oh so tempting large-screen tv perfectly positioned close to the bed. The bathroom is to die for! Large with a bathtub next to the windows and a great view. For those who are timid, there are electronic shades which you can raise or lower with a control switch plate on the wall when you come into the bathroom. There is a see-through shower close to the bathtub from which you can also get a great view thrugh the windows. The products were nice. If you're into design, what I really loved was the wide and tall sleek wood sliding door with an elongated cylindrical stainless steel handle so that when closed, you weren't even aware of the presence of a bathroom. This was just one striking feature of this very well designed room. As for food, apart from raiding the minibar which had a good selection of snacks and drinks, we didn't eat at the hotel restaurant but we did have room service since we were too tired and wet to go out again for dinner. (Yes, it rained the whole time we were in Seattle which is probably why the flowers and vegetables are so gorgeous probably). I had a deconstructed Caesar salad with grilled prawns which was good. Would I return to this hotel? In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and restaurant, great location”
Reviews.Author: MEME94
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 1000 one night while returning from an Alaska cruise via Seattle. Chose it through Trip Advisor reviews and also got a very good rate. We arrived before 10am. Since our room was not ready we had a delicious breakfast at BOKA then walked around Pioneer Square for a couple of hours and visited the Klondike Gold Rush Visitor Center. We were pleasantly surprised to find a very spacious, beautifully furnished and stylish room. The the king bed was very confortable as well as the side chair. Large dresser/storage/bar area with lots of space for your stuff. Flat screen with HD. Huge bathroom with separate shower and toilet areas, a soaking tub and granite vanity. Very clean. Nice toiletries and fluffy linens. Even though our reservation was for a "limited view room" we had large windows and a nice view (if limited) of the Seattle skyline.

Reviews.Title: “It's very special.”
Reviews.Author: monmouthspring
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very special place to stay, this is it. The rooms are beautiful; the staff is wonderful; views are spectacular, & beds are sooo comfy! Attention to detail, which you rarely find anywhere is everywhere here - both in the room design and by the staff. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is our new favorite in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway for a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: 4evertravelbug8
Reviews.Content: Our Hotel 1000 stay was a positive experience from the time I booked our anniversary getaway until our late check-out, which they offered as they didn't want us to have to rush after our massages. The service was subtly superb. "Happy Anniversary" cupcakes awaited us in our corner City View room. The view was more unattractive building than city, but the room was huge and well appointed for both form and function, with a comfortable chaise and expansive work station. BOKA has more of a lively bar atmosphere than intimate restaurant feel . The tapas style dishes and the service were only okay, but the view from our corner table made for fun people watching. French press coffee in the room followed by massages at SPAAHH, Hotel 1000's spa, made for an awesome morning. We didn't check out the virtual reality golf club on this trip. One of many reasons to return to Hotel 1000!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: WWKY
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel. Great service. great location. Comfortable mattress and beddings. Love the bathroom - separate shower and stand-alone bath tub that filled up from a source in the ceiling. Will definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: skwimmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night prior to Alaska Cruise and three nights after the week long cruise to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. Hotel is centrally located in downtown, has a great restaurant (BOKA) and bar, valet parking, and a caring and helpful staff. Great views of the harbor from upper floors. In-room coffee was fresh ground Starbucks with a pot to heat water and a "Press" pot to make the coffee. Easy to make reservations directly to the hotel on the Internet and got a great discount in the process. Prices very reasonable considering the amenities and the beautiful condition of the rooms and the hotel. Comfy beds and non-smoking rooms. Will not stay anywhere else in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Not too small, but small enough”
Reviews.Author: LiveAmused
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed on business at Hotel 1000. The location, at the corner of Madison and 1st and only a few blocks to Pike Market and other sites, is one of the best. There is a feeling of calm and peace as you enter the modest but modern lobby. The check in process was very quick and were upgraded to a corner suite on the top floor as requested. The room was spacious and the bathroom great. The only problem was low water pressure in shower. The staff are discrete and efficient. We only had breakfasts at the hotel's small restaurant which was good (not excellent). The great thing for those in need of internet is that it is free. If you don't have a laptop with you, no worries...They have a small computer room at the lobby floor with 3 computers and a printer and also a dedicated Business Center on the 4th floor. All complimentary. Spa is very good also. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “contemporary comfort in the heart of seattle”
Reviews.Author: wskungfuclub
Reviews.Content: went to seattle for a wedding and stayed at the hotel 1000. wow! we loved our room. who wouldn't like a bathtub that fills from the ceiling and molten brown bath products! the room had all the modern conveniences--ipod connector, lcd tv, etc. the services were great--they had complimentary shoe shine, clothes steaming, newspapers. they had prepackaged bags of ice in an ice chest right outside the room. the wife and i both got massages at the spa and got chocolate covered strawberries and champagne for valentines day--not to mention one of the best massages i've ever gotten (and i've gotten massages all over the world). the concierge was great and gave us directions and tips on everything (and provided umbrellas of course!). the customer service was top notch. as for location, you are within walking distance of a limitless supply of fantastic seafood restaurants as well as the museum of art and fish market. this hotel is an absolute gem. because we were going for a wedding and had a lot of friends in town spread out over a bunch of different hotels we got to see a lot of them. they all lacked the unique style and luxury of hotel 1000. we will definitely stay there again next time we are in seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Not great--and erroneous charges on my bill”
Reviews.Author: venicesnapper
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the hotel 1000 recently. For the class of hotel, I was surpised by the lack of professionalism in the staff. It seemd like there was no one working there over the age of 25. As if the adults had all gone away, and it was being run by college students. When I received my credit card bill later, I found an additional charge by the hotel that I did not recognize and did not authorize. I tried calling the hotel about it, and left a voice mail for "Bernard" in Accounting. I never received a return call from anyone at the hotel. So, I was forced to challenge the charge with my credit card. The hotel sure responded to them in no time with a false claim that my rate did nto include free valet parking (which it did--and was why I was not charged for it when i checked out). After a second go-around, the hotel finally realized thier mistake and reversed the charge. but it was a lot of effort--and symbolic of how poorly the hotel is run.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghIain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after our Alaskan Cruise. The Hotel Location is excellent, just 5 minutes from cruise ship port. Nearby restaurants and shopping are plentiful. The staff are pleasant and cannot do enough for you. All in all probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in, can highly recommend to anyone considering accommodation in Seattle, you will not get better than this.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location & service!”
Reviews.Author: lilbert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently travelled to Seattle for our first anniversary and his birthday. This hotel was AMAZING - the location can not be beat, the service was excellent and the rooms were well appointed and clean. I was so pleased with everything about this hotel and would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone. If and when we go back, we will definitely be visiting Hotel 1000 again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: oneswellshell
Reviews.Content: Amazed by the genuine service, the attention to details and over experience! Simple things add up. My registration with Allison was great. She treated me as a friend not a sale. When I arrived I was greeted by a happy doorman. the experience continued at the front desk. I felt like I was a regular VIP at the hotel, yet this was my first visit. The room is amazing (I stayed in the normal room, not a suite or upgraded room. The TV system has everything, including hook-up for you i-Pod. Don't worry if you forgot your i-Pod cables you will find loaners in your room! The bathroom is very cool! The bath tub is huge with a rubber ducky and all the bath supplies you could want. And of course, the bed is great. I could have spent a day just enjoying the room and hotel amenities. Needless to say, Hotel 1000 will be my hotel for all of my Seattle business trips!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond in Every Area!”
Reviews.Author: rvhavingfun
Reviews.Content: Booking ~ Booked on-line about 3 weeks before the trip using the web special. Booked the Luxe Guestroom (no view or suite) for $180 a night which is well below the regular price. I called to confirm 3 days before and they sent me an e-mail for pre-arrival that we could fill out and send back requesting car service from the airport or to book spa services, etc. We didn't book anything at that time, but did let them know we would be arriving early (8:30 am) and if we could check in early. We asked the best way to get from the airport to the hotel. They suggested car service for $75, taxi service at about $35 or the Link Light Rail at $5. We opted for the Light Rail. It was only a few blocks to the hotel from the station and we travel light so it was excellent and a great way to see the city (takes about an hour). Check-In ~ We arrived at 8:30 am and were not only checked in immediately, but were upgraded to a choice of rooms that Jaime took us to to check out. We were given the choice of a suite with a sitting room, but no tub or a city view corner room with a tub. I wanted the tub! We were unpacked before 9 am. Incredible! The Room ~ Room had ceiling to floor windows on 3 sides. Tons of natural light. Awesome. King bed was very comfortable with fabulous sheets. So soft. My husband loved the pillows, but I prefer a firmer one, which they sent up immediately. Sitting area with a chair, coffee table and couch (pull-out). Very comfy place to read your choice of complimentary newspapers in the morning. Desk and technology area was well-equipped with cords (iPhone, etc) if you forgot them. FREE Wifi, which is usually such a rip off when you have to pay. Laptop size safe (large enough for 13 inch, not sure about 15 inch though) and really fun options on the TV). Free local AND long distance calls. Bar, coffee area was nice. Ice in bags right outside our room in coolers rather than those loud ice machines. Bathroom was a highlight for me. Beautiful shower (enough room for 2) with a comforting shower head. Incredible 2 person bathtub that fills from the ceiling and the tap is on the wall which means no tap or spout in the way. It was really relaxing, especially with a window overlooking the city (there was a shade that lowered electronically if you wanted). Molten Brown products were nice and I appreciated the large bottles on the wall instead of those wasteful small bottles that you take home, but never use. Boka Restaurant ~ We had brunch and it was good. I loved the truffle fries! The Studio ~ Nice seats and fire to sit around. We played a game of checkers on the computer table (like a huge iPad). Spaahh ~ I had a body treatment done (Enrapture). It was relaxing and great for my skin. On par price wise with any other hotel I have had spa treatments. Virtual Golf ~ My husband did this while I had my spa treatment. He booked a tee time the day before, but may not be required. Only negative was that someone had left there young teens there and they were messing around in the second tee box. It didn't bother my husband, but when two others came to really play they wouldn't leave. More of a parenting thing than hotel thing though. They also have a Wii with an assortment of games. Library ~ Lovely room with classic books and comfy chairs. Front Desk, Housekeeping, Concierge and Overall Service ~ Early check-in and up-grade was great, thanks Jaime. Complimentary coffee and or iced tea in the lobby was welcome! Housekeeping was done promptly and wonderfully whenever we pushed to button to have our room made up. We were never bothered when we had the electronic Do Not Disturb on. Excellent recommendations for dinner and reservations made, thanks Colten and Casey. We went to Metropolitan Grill and Casey had an amazing appetizer waiting for us. Above and beyond. There was a town car to take us around downtown as a complimentary service. We are walkers so we didn't use it, but we saw others use it and they were impressed. We were there celebrating our anniversary and we came home on our first night to a note from the staff as well as a plate of superb cupcakes and Happy Anniversary to us written in chocolate on the plate. Yummy!! Check-out ~ Quick! We also used the Business center to print out our boarding passes. We walked back to the Light Rail and headed home. Overall ~ This hotel was amazing, clean, modern and service was the best I've ever experienced. Location was great for us and we walked everywhere! We will return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! I am away from home 300 days a year and this is my favorite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMeacham
Reviews.Content: Last year my wife Christine and I came to Seattle for our five year anniversary. We stayed at the Hotel 1000 and I have to say it is my favorite hotel that I stay out. Super swanky, contemporary, amazing service, great decor, etc. The restaurant is just ok. I ordered a veggie burger and it was nice - just nice. This trip was all business but when I came back to the hotel I felt happy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiPortland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel often and are very discriminating, picky travelers. This hotel exceeded our expectations. From the valet service to the front desk, everyone was friendly and helpful. Our room had a beautiful view of the water. The room had very nice touches and the bathroom was fantastic with that glass wall and huge bathtub with water coming out of the ceiling. At check in, the woman (Itzel or something close to that) asked if we were celebrating an occasion and my husband proudly blurted out, "her 30th birthday," (much to my embarrassment)! When we went back up to our room after walking around a bit, the hotel had delivered champagne and strawberries with a personalized note saying happy 30th birthday. It was a very nice, unexpected touch. When we went down to dinner at the restaurant the front desk greeted us by name and they had only spoken to us once! To us, those are the things that really put a hotel at the top of our list. The restaurant had great drinks too. A lot of the time hotel bars can be a rip off, but we watched the bartender make our drinks and he used excellent liquor and did not short change us on the amount of alcohol. When we left, the valet attendants were excellent. One opened my husband's door and one opened mine. They got our seat belts for us and left us each a bottle of chilled water for the road. Overall, a great experience! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal Getaway in my own home town”
Reviews.Author: seattlesmyhome
Reviews.Content: Didn't have to fly to an exotic place to experience the luxury and top notch service that was present at the Hotel 1000. The room was spectacular from the decor to the lovely view of boats and puget sound. The service was second to none. From the valet parking attendants, to the front desk, to the delivery man who inquired about my satisfaction of my room and stay I felt like a king in my own backyard. Had a clandestine chat with the general manager on our way out...how many GM's take 15 min out of their day to talk to your average guest regarding his hotel...I have not experienced that before. Mr. Fitzpatrick is doing a superb job managing this facility. I look forward to spending my anniversary at this hotel next year too...

Reviews.Title: “The perfect concierge service”
Reviews.Author: sf2525
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 is a great hotel. Right close to all attractions, a nice restaurant for breakfast and cool golf simulator. But for me the most amazing thing was their concierge service. During our stay they helped us with recommendations and restaurant reservations. And then I forget a shirt in the room when I checked out. I only noticed it when I was already home. We mailed them and they send it down to us with UPS free of charge. That's what I call great service! Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: PinotSeller
Reviews.Content: Next trip back to Seattle, we will definately return to Hotel 1000. Great location and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Rooms were comfortable, attractive and clean. The bed was a bit soft, and when we requested a bed board, it was installed immediately. We especially liked the tea/coffee service, more Euro than most US hotels. We usually don't like to eat at hotel restaurants, but the Bako had a great breakfast - in fact it was really great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: tbone6
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Good restaurant, great location to sites/businesses, super cool bathtubs, clean, gym, business center, and super friendly staff. I would definitely stay here again. Walked to the Space Needle, Pike Street Market, shopping, wharf, and underground tour. And convenient to local businesses and hospitals as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: giraffeoftruth
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel experience I've had for a very long time. From the moemnt we arrived the staff were fantastic, friendly and very helpful. We had a room on a high floor with a view of the water. The room was spacious, clean and nicely presented. There's a nice tv and wi-fi, plus a few other connectors provided to allow to charge phones that use the mini usb format. The bed was comfy and the room seemed pretty peaceful, possibly because it' was high up.The bathroom had a lovely big bath which fills from the ceiling, that's probably a bit unnecessary, but... The location is good, and pretty central, with Pike Place market about 5 mins up the road. We ordered room service, which came promptly and well prepared with good-sized portions. We had a small problem with the bathroom, which was fixed within 15 mins at 9pm, which is what I'd expect at a decent hotel. We had a great time here, largely because of the great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Tip-top, immaculate and I approve.”
Reviews.Author: martidav
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I staycationed for a romantical Valentines Day night. The room is a nerd's paradise if you will, complete with extra cables (even iPod/Phone) if needed. An A/V port box on the desk compliments this nerdiness. A well appointed minibar is a welcome site and is shelved with fingerprint-free wine and water glasses. Naturally, there is a selection of spendy chips and snacks if you don't feel like walking a block to the local convenience stores. The tub that fills from the ceiling is a nice touch and its tendency with splash the bathroom is overshadowed by the coolness of the effect. Side note: the water pressure all around and can get scalding hot. By the way, separation wall is made of glass with a power activated shade. Don't worry, the toilet and separate shower are enclosed in frosted glass. Staff was super nice and punctual. We over indulged on dinner and we were brought Pepto with a smile and silver platter - literally. Although we didn't eat at the attached Boka restaurant, we party there for after work Happy Hours and know it's great joint. Opportunities for improvement: Bathroom needs and fan or a fully enclosed and sealed toilet stall - candles do help a little. Hot/cold indicators needed on the sink - the water can get awesomely hot really fast. Shower stall needs a mat or tacky surface; it's a little slick in there. Bed is surprisingly hard for the digs and price.

Reviews.Title: “To big to boutique”
Reviews.Author: Philip_L_Meehan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fairly pleasant but trying to disguise itself as 'boutique & Technologically advanced' is a joke. The phone system is just a standard Cisco Voip with a colour screen containing weather details. The sound system was terrible with untidy wiring. For the plus side so I don't sound like a completely miserable b*stard. The bathroom was great with very funky features like the water filling the bath from the ceiling and the huge shower. The room service was good, but it was cheeky there was a charge to use the bath salts. Especially when paying that much in the beginning. The location was excellent and I managed to get some tickets for the Seahawks game.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays in N.America”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTripper
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 is a boutique hotel that seems to be able to add a wonderful personal touch to their service. A quick and pleasant checkin experience - while taking floor request into consideration; exceptionally appointed and comfortable rooms. It's located minutes off Pike Place and in close proximity to other SEA sites.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjthekid
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been more pleased with the Hotel 1000. We were there for business and the staff and facilities were all excellent. The water views are spectacular. Great location. The price we got was ridiculously low for a hotel of this caliber. It is a very high-tech hotel, the tubs fill from the ceiling, the minibar is computerized. The cleaning staff notify you on the screen of your in room telephone. Free VOIP calling. All in all it is the perfect hotel (for business or for a trip to the great city of Seattle. ) As you can see, I'm a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssdiamondhead
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel 1000 twice now and both times we have had an exceptional stay. From the concierge to the bell man to the front desk, everything was exceptional. We were even driven to the 24 hour market on a Sunday night by the front door man because we needed some medicine. Highly recommend this beautiful hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: RNLIII
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in downtown Seattle and loved this Hotel. On our flight back to Missouri my wife and I discussed other hotels we had seen and could not think of anything even comparable. It was new, fun, nice, clean, friendly, and close to everything we wanted to do. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Great location- AMAZING STAFF!!”
Reviews.Author: ThatTrvlGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed the weekend of Jan 15-17 2010. If there ever was a time that a hotel stepped up and impressed me, it was this one! First off, the room- a corner junior suite overlooking 1st ave and Madison. Very spacious, plus the bathroom was amazing in itself. The whole room is set up for the tech junkie. Forgot your cables? No worries- they have some in the closet. Good thinking! The courtesy car is a great amenity that I took advantage of a couple times ( more on that in a sec). Anyway, it's within walking distance to Pike Market, Seattle Art Museum, and numerous pubs and restaurants. I did walk to the Space Needle one morning, but I reccomend taking a cab or the car if it's available. This is where the hotel staff went above and beyond - while in Seattle I was mugged near the SAM one night. I had to be taken to the hospital, but I was released a few hours later. I called the front desk to have them send a cab for me, but instead they sent the car. It felt like to me that the staff made my welfare a top priority. Even upon arriving home I was met with an email from the hotel making sure that I didnt forget anything, and they even offered help with any police reports regarding my incident. Just for the record, I do not hold the hotel nor the city responsible for the acts of 2 street thugs that I was unfortunate enough to run into. I will definitely reccommend the Hotel 1000 to everyone I speak to. I look forward to staying there in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Classy yet not fussy”
Reviews.Author: Foodie727
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The rooms were modern, expensive, and chic, without being overly fussy. Our bathroom had a glass wall with a privacy shade and a tub that filled from the ceiling, very cool. I forgot my umbrella and they supplied me with one. The service at this hotel was amazing. My favorite thing? The complimentary curbside caddie (a black Cadillac town car) chauffeured by a friendly staff member. We were there for five days however and it was only available for us once when we needed it. But that one time was great. I also particularly enjoyed that there was always an elevator waiting for us in the lobby when we got in for the evening Drawbacks, there is no easy hotel to airport transportation besides a taxi which runs between 32-40 dollars. A shuttle service would have been very nice. They also don't mention anywhere online that this rather expensive hotel is right next door to a 24 hour sex shop.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Oregontraveler1975
Reviews.Content: We needed a few days to explore downtown Seattle before taking a cruise to Alaska and we found this sparkling gem! We loved the muted colors and the lighting of unusual artwork. It was very cosmopolitan and chic. The rooms were extremely comfortable, modern and impeccably clean and comfortable. High end ammenities. The spa was clean, well kept and very compact. The massage was ok. The neighborhood was really fun and great nearby restaurants along with the famous fisherman's wharf which can keep you entertained for hours! The concierge did a great job assisting us and we had all around really great service. The bell men were also super!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel...Better Than W”
Reviews.Author: ATLHotelLuva
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel 1000 when I visited Seattle on business. I usually stay at the W due to my SPG status. However, the client I visited receives a great rate at the Hotel 1000, so I tried it out. WOW! Love that hotel. The decor, like so many boutiques, is a sophisticated chic. However, they chose fabrics and fixtures that seem more elegant as opposed to trite. ROOM: The room was a spacious, high tech state of blissfulness! My room had a stand alone tub apart from the shower, which overlooks the main bedroom. They then included an electronic shade you could retract for privacy while still being able to keep it open for daylight or TV viewing. The room was also VERY clean. I often udge the quality of the hotel by whether my clorox travel wipes get dirty when I re-wipe things like the remote control, phone, nobs/handles, etc. Definite attention to cleaning detail...passed my test. STUDIO LOUNGE: The Studio Lounge (lobby bar area) was also quite pleasant. Great wine list, fun time with the staff. Love the fire place seating...but get there fast. People call ahead and reserve these, and the room is SMALL STAFF: Very friendly and helpful staff. Big props to General Manager Denny Fitzpatrick. VERY friendly, accomodating and an absolute pleasurable man. LOVED IT! I will be staying again for sure! CONS: 1) food was just OK. Breakfast was WAY overprices 2) The rooms with "No View" are looking at a cement wall! 3) Bed was a smidge uncomfortable (nice linens but hard)

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel!! WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachesVancouver
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend gettaway to Seattle. Decided to splurge and stay at the Hotel 1000 based on all the favourable Trip Advisor reviews. Let me tell you that if you want to treat yourself, definitely stay here!! The entire hotel experience was fantastic, from the friendly staff, the welcoming champagne, complimentary cupcakes for my boyfriend's birthday, the gorgeous modern room and top notch 2 person soaker bath tub. Worth all the money right there!! It's not often you leave a hotel thinking "WOW". You won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Gogatormom
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Hotel 1000 twice. This hotel exceeds all our expectations of what a fine hotel should be. The rooms are beautiful, the service is top-notch and we left feeling completely pampered. The restaurant, BOKA, serves delicious, artfully presented food with exceptional service and attention to detail. Hotel 1000 is our first and only choice when we visit Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soulex
Reviews.Content: This hotel was originally passed over due to price in concern of the ending location for a date I had planned with my girlfriend. I decided to go in and check it out (as it is very conveniently located near Pike's Market). The concierge gave me a room by room tour as well as showed me the rest of the facilities which included a spa, a virtual golf area and their restaurant. The rooms in themselves are amazing. The room is built around the bathroom. The bathtub is very deep and can easily fit more than one person in them. The water falls from the ceiling (in a very neat and aesthetic way) without causing any splash to the ground on any side of the tub. The view is very nice, and the bed was very comfortable. The room was easily the best I've ever been in in all of my travels. Valet parking is very nice on the busy street. It is located near Pike's Market which is a must see for anyone visiting the Seattle area. Though I did not eat at their provided restaurant, I had an in house bottle of wine and it was very good for the price. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who's wallets can afford them a little bit of luxury. The extra dollars is well worth it compared to anywhere else I have slept in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Treat you like Family - if your family lives in a 5 Star Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Burger55
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 is one of the most pleasurable experiences that you can have while traveling. Rooms are very generous in size and the decor is wonderful. The best feature of the hotel, is the staff. Wonderful people that will take an interest in your stay, help you enjoy the hotel and the city, and will always be there to serve you. I travel just about every week for work and the hotel and staff consistently rank at the top of my favorite places. Location: Close to the waterfront, near Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square, easy walk to just about everything in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and were very surprised by the atmosphere, the helpfulness of all employees, the spa experience, the restaurant, and the room itself. The hotel feel is very modern, yet not cold or unwelcoming. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful and we really felt that they wanted us to have a good experience. We went to the restaurant bar a couple of times and the waiter and bartender remembered us and our room number, as well as what we liked to drink. The food was also very good. I had a manicure, my partner had a massage and both were reasonable and also very good. We used the fitness room. Also, the guest room was amazing - glass wall dividing the room from the bathroom with a privacy screne. There were sculptures and art work and the room was a very nice place to come home to. I would highly recommend this hotel. If we ever go back to Seattle, we will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Seattle, WA”
Reviews.Author: Sapphire051
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of downtown Seattle and is top notch. The decor is contemporary yet professional. Everything is clean. The service was outstanding. The rooms are new, fresh and have a spa like feel. The wall between the bedroom and the bathroom is glass with a privacy shade option. The tub is deep and the water fills from the ceiling. A person can literally soak in the tub and watch a movie or sports at the same time! Outstanding accommodations along with superb customer service. It doesn't get any better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RobynnM
Reviews.Content: I just got back from vacation with a stop in Seattle...stayed at the the W for 2 nights and Hotel 1000 blew the W away in all respects. I strongly recommend staying here..great location, great room, reasonably priced, great bar, friendly staff and modern.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: cutecheeks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel on the last leg of our road trip. We called ahead to find out if they could valet park our truck with the huge over the cab camper on the back of it and they said no problem. When we drove up, they hardly even blinked....just drove off and found a place to park it ;) They allowed us to check in early, gave us an upgrade to a city view room and then allowed us to check out late. The room was awesome..the bed was comfortable and I absolutely loved the bathtub and shower. We both got sick, so we spent our whole Seattle experience in this hotel. The staff was so friendly and very willing to help. Worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “1000 Ways to Pamper Guests”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler57
Reviews.Content: For a one night business stay, I checked into the 1000 Hotel in Downtown Seattle. Great location on First Avenue, walking distance to Seattle Art Museum, Benaroya Symphony Hall, Pike Place Market, shopping and nightlife. Check in was flawless with valet parking and my room overlooking First Ave and Elliott Bay was spectacular. Sleek modern vibe, huge flatscreen television tuned to a cool channel of rotating destinations struck the right note for my stay. Free NY Times in the morning. The bathroom was ultra modern if a bit hard-edge contemporary. I liked the downstairs restaurant but the front desk was iffy with directions to other spots. They gave me wrong directions to one request. The concierge was on top of his game and knew much more than the clerks. No pool but nice exercise room and spa. A good choice for a downtown location. And, then there is the phone system...WAY too complicated to make a simple call. It took me three tries to get my car back from valet parking, but it was the only sour note in an otherwise sweet stay. I highly recommend it and Boka restaurant/bar. Much better than nearby W Hotel or the Alexis across the street.

Reviews.Title: “I travel a lot and have stayed in many hotels - in my own city, this one is a 10!”
Reviews.Author: valtam01
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were celebrating our 30th birthdays locally. Both of us have had jobs were we've traveled a lot and where we've stayed in many hotels, however this one impressed us with the extra touches. The room was very clean and state of the art and really the spa was great. The service was fantastic and very friendly. Some of the extra touches: roses for our birthday over lunch, champagne in the lobby, chocolate covered strawberries sent to the room and water bottles in the car when we left the hotel. If any one wants a suggestion on where to stay in Seattle, I'm immediately sending them to Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Second time to stay in a year!”
Reviews.Author: peaceseeker58
Reviews.Content: We struggled a little getting extra linens for the sofa bed and into our room when we arrived, but all- in -all the bathroom facilities were wonderful and the comfort of the regular bed was great! They did a good job trying to correct a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: creidcooks
Reviews.Content: What a treat. We stayed at the hotel following a cruise to Alaska. The room was perfect (and sooo roomy after seven days in a cabin on a cruise boat). Everything about the place is lovely. The people were warm and friendly. They took our bags even though we arrived hours before check in time. When we came back from a shopping trip to Pikes Market with a huge box of fish packed for the airplane they offered to put it in their refrigerator so we would'nt have to keep it in our room. The fellow at the door always recognised us walking up the street after the first meeting and had the door open for us when we arrived! More $ than we normally spend, but we'll worth it. We'd go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traveller_11022
Reviews.Content: I wanted to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday so we picked Hotel 1000 based on all the positive reviews on this website. We have never been to Seattle before, so the staff really helped us out by directing us to places and arranging the town car for us. We also enjoy the hotel's restaurant Boka very much. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a luxurious weekend of romance and relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: agriff277
Reviews.Content: Our stay started with wonderful service, everyone we came in contact with was very nice and helpful. The rooms are great, however we found other touches were what made the hotel. We enjoyed the valet parking, spa treatments, virtual golf, and the complimentary town car service. Great location right in the middle of downtown, walking distance to great shopping and sightseeing. While there I would also highly recommend the Melting Pot fondue restaurant...very fun experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bruins77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 1 night on out trip through the Northwest. It is in a good location - only about 4 or 5 blocks to Pike Place Market and a two minute drive to the ferries. One downside - there is an "adult" store next door and a strip club about 2 blocks up the street. The hotel itself was very clean and the room was very nice. Staff was very friendly. We didn't use any of the amenities as we were only there for 1 night. Ask for a room situated away from the alley. Even though we were 10 floors up, I heard the dumpsters being emptied at 6 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: ramblinboyChicago
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal for visiting Pike's Market, it's just a few blocks walk down the street, and luckily, not up any of the hills. It's even closer to the waterfront dining down the hill. The staff was incredibly helpful. We got complimentary champagne upon check in, a ride to our restaurant a few blocks away, and a button and sewing kit to replace a broken one. The view is nothing to speak of (we looked east), but the comfort of the room made it unnecessary.
