We brought our two small French Bulldogs knowing the property was "pet friendly", but had no idea how accomodating they would be! When we checked in our room wasn't quite ready (we were early), so they sent us to the bar for free drinks and took care of our dogs, even offering to walk them for us. When we got into the room (not even 15 minutes later), there were dog bowls, beds and goodies waiting for them. The room was beautiful, spotless and every interaction we had with the front desk and concierge was wonderful. The waitstaff in the lounge and restaurant were fantastic and even the valets knew our dogs names by the time we left. We will go back as often as possible!

Reviews.Title: “What An Awesome Place!!”
Reviews.Author: pcmpapacherry
Reviews.Content: Wow! I booked this hotel for a trip to celebrate my best friends birthday. She had never stayed in a nice hotel, and I wanted it to be really special. When we pulled up to the Hotel, two valets came rushing out, and alerted the front desk that we had arrived. We were checked in, in about 5 minutes tops. I had let them know that I was coming for my friends birthday, and they gave her a free spaahh facial, (which she said was incredible)! Now, on to the rooms. Geez, what a place! When we opened the door, classical music was playing on the fourty inch television, very well decorated, and it smelled terrific! The bathroom was amazing. It had a frosted glass shower door, as well as one hiding the commode, and a huge seperate deep soaking tub. The coolest part was that the water to fill the tub comes from the ceiling!! There is a glass wall with a optional retractable shade that seperated the bathroom from the room itself. The lotions, and soaps were amazing. It was the nicest hotel I have stayed at in Seattle, and I have stayed in all of them! ALSO, is was cheaper than most of them! I loved it! It's the only place that I ever want to stay again! Oh, and the bed and linens were just amazing! I can't wait to go back next month!! It doesn't hurt that everyone who works there is gorgeous either!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel on 1st street”
Reviews.Author: CuriouslyStrong4me
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are v. friendly and go extra steps to ensure guests are comfortable. Examples during our stay: we bought a case of wine from a local store, and the front desk delivered it to our room promptly. We were notified on our Cisco phone via a text message -- very cool touch. We called for a cab twice, once local and once to the airport, but were offered the hotel's town car for use (free, and for the same price as a cab, respectively). I think we got a fantastic room, but could have paid less, according to some other reviewers here. Sounds like our $335 room is exactly like or very similar to someone who paid $225 during the same month of stay. I agree with everything pompom79 says about the hotel. My husband & I found it annoying that in Seattle of all places, there was no alternative music selection in the TVs music channels. Music in the bathroom would have been nice. The hotel is proud of the digital art on the TV; however, our TV display has already been burned by leaving the TV on most of the time; an ever-present ghost scroll bar is distracting. The location is very convenient - easy walks to ball fields, pier, and Pike's Market. we were v. surprised at how reasonable the mini-bar items were: $17 for a 1/2 bottle of a nice, drinkable Dunham blend; $4 or so for a beer; $7 for a bath fizzy.

Reviews.Title: “One of my top-rated hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: pompom79
Reviews.Content: I'm a complete hotel snob after having been subjected to too many highway motels on childhood road trips - call it my form of adolescent rebellion, but since I was old enough to book my own trips, I've never been able to deal with anything less than a 4* hotel. That being said, I do try to find the best deal possible, and have been lucky enough to have stayed in some gorgeous rooms at great prices over the years. Hotel 1000, though, tops the list. My husband and I were heading down to Seattle for a concert and wanted someplace chic, comfortable and close to the venue. After reading Hotel 1000's reviews, there was no question as to where we'd be staying. We booked their most basic room for $225/night, which turned out to anything but basic. The bathroom was incredibly large, with a shower, 2-person ceiling-filled tub, and wonderful amenities, including a loofah sponge. The room itself was massive (we were in a corner room, slightly larger than the regular basic rooms, I believe), with an incredibly comfortable bed. Turndown service left little chocolates on the pillow, we very much enjoyed the French press-brewed Starbucks coffee, and the robes were simply sumptuous. Free wifi and VOIP calls are a nice touch and would make this a perfect place for an extended business stay. Beyond the room, the hotel itself is very nice - intimate and very stylish. There's delicious complementary strawberry lemonade in the lobby, a treat almost as sweet as the staff. I have never yet encountered a staff as gracious and helpful as Hotel 1000's - from the valets who greeted us (and happily retrieved some items we had left in the car when we called down), to the concierge and front desk staff, everyone we encountered was having a great time doing their jobs - their pride in their place of work certainly shows. A fabulous stay, and I don't think I could stay anywhere else in Seattle after having experienced Hotel 1000!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: EAP3232
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience at Hotel 1000! If you are interested in a "boutique hotel" in downtown this is a great option. Excellent location - walking distance to Pike Place Market and lots of restaurants. The rooms are very contemporary ... comfortable bed ... usable desk space for the business traveler ... nice bathroom amenities. I was there for a week for business/pleasure and the staff was consistently excellent - they were very genuine and always went out of there way to greet me and offer their assistance. I got room service and ate at BOKA and thought the food was very good. I would absolutely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Massage!”
Reviews.Author: Kpartlow1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel 1000 with my boyfriend. Great arrival experience. My bf couldn't get enough of the complimentary strawberry-lavendar infused lemonade available near the front desk. I think he smuggled about 10 cups of it over the course of our stay! Our room was the 4th floor. I definitely recommend asking for a higher room. While our view of 1st street directly below us was okay, I would have preferred a view of the water. The massage I had at the Spa was amazing! Definitely one of the best massages I've ever had. My boyfriend and I used the fitness center (a bit small but nice) and the library on the 4th floor, a really cute place to sit by the fire. The location of Hotel 1000 was also great. We walked everywhere - only 10 minutes to Pike Place and near the pier. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty French Press”
Reviews.Author: uncosito
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at Hotel 1000. Probably the last...why don't I learn. It's a great looking hotel and I LOVE the bathroom and tub, but why can't they clean a french press?! It's disgusting. The french press smells like rancid coffee oils and you can see the coffee residue and oils on the various parts. Take a look if you choose to stay here. Pull apart the filter and see how many coffee grounds you find between the pieces. Just a note: there shouldn't be any. Wipe a napkin around the lid and on the bottom of the filter plate and see how much coffee grime comes off. If you get any, it's not clean. I expect more for $200 plus a night and four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Luxury & Technology”
Reviews.Author: Rusty2280
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a contemporary room with the latest technology in the downtown area of Seattle, THIS IS THE PLACE. Sony plasma televisions on the wall of each guest room have excellent sound and HD programs, however you may find as I did, to be glued to the hotel's personal channels showing HD photographs of scenes from around the world set to soothing music. Mention you like golf to the excellent staff at the front desk when you check in, and when you enter your room, classical music will be playing and the television will be set to the channel showing the greatest golf courses of the world. There are approximately a dozen channels that feature photographic slide shows on subjects from sailing to hiking to tropical resorts. Seriously cool. Of COURSE everyone will mention the bathroom with the glass wall opening into the bedroom and the tub that fills from the ceiling, this is a luxury, spa like setting and the bathroom is almost as state of the art as their technology. WIFI is throughout the hotel's common areas and in each guest room. The telephones are VOIP technology with guides to the hotel, the area and the nightlife right on the phone screen. Ask the front desk for a water view room if possible, facing west, although I imagine the city view rooms are just as spectacular. The hotel restaurant, BOKA is a wise choice for happy hour (with tapas-style "urban bites" for half price as well as the drinks). A golf club with two golf simulator bays is in the lower level of the hotel along with their fitness center and spaaaah (as they call it). Plan to check out the golf simulator during happy hours weekdays for 1/2 price golf and drinks, almost feels like your on the course. The staff is unbelievable, service is efficient and professional, the only delay in any service is getting your car from the hotel valet (as they have to park it off-site). The hotel's location is at 1st and Madison, an easy walk to Pike Place Market, the Seattle Art Museum, the waterfront, ferries and numerous restaurants. Rates were decent for this level of service, around $200 per night, ask for the AAA discount, it's not officially offered, but the great reservations people will give you a discount to match. Call them now if you are planning a trip to Seattle for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings but stunning rooms”
Reviews.Author: christel
Reviews.Content: Lovely spacious rooms with relaxing colour schemes and fascinating bath room with the electric blind to shield me from the office workers. :) What a shock when the column of water descended from the ceiling! Did not enjoy the food offering in BOKA- very oily winter veg with lovely white fish- yuk. Breakfast was more acceptable with the mini buffet. No bread though only pastries. Don't understand why US hotels do not bother withhealthy eating? I had to be very careful what I chose to avoid nausea nad indigestion . Maybe I am spoiled on this side of the pond? Considered the spa offering but rooms very pokey so passed on that. Got my nails done at a local salon up the road- VERY reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: 2DOTGuys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the long MLK weekend in January 2008. Everything met our expectations. The staff was professional, friendly, and very helpful. The location made seeing Seattle on foot easy. The room was wonderful (great design and a great bathroom) and had a great view of Elliot Bay and the Olympic Mountains across Puget Sound. We also enjoyed the spa services and Boka restaurant, which was quite excellent. We will definitely stay there again the next time we go to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “What a disapointment!”
Reviews.Author: godiva2012
Reviews.Content: After reading the 5-star reviews and getting a recommendation from a few locals, we checked into the Hotel 1000. We booked one of their bigger suites with 2 flat screen TVs, luxury bath, etc. While the staff was quite friendly and the concierge helpful, my problems were with the lack of basic amenities and cleanliness of the bathrooms. My first morning at the hotel, I entered the granite shower with 2 showerheads trying to figure out how to turn the 2 faucets on without getting soaked in cold water, for the knobs were at the far end of the shower and there was no way of avoiding the spray. That was the least of my problems because after I recovered from the ice bath, followed by the scorching heat of the hard-to-adjust temperature setting I realized that there is absolutely no water pressure. There was barely any water trickling out of the shower heads which made it impossible to rinse. Second shock? While fiddling with the temperature knob, I pulled off a wad of someone’s hair on my hand. Minutes later I noticed more foreign hair on the shower walls, Gross! After 10 minutes of trying to rinse unsuccessfully, I decided to just rinse my hair in the sink (which became my daily routine for the next 5 days). There is absolutely no water pressure at all. The next day, I decided to give the soaking tub a try. My first attempt to fill the tub, produced a tub full of dirty sudsy water- apparently they never rinsed it off from the previous guest, so I set out to clean the tub myself. On my 3rd attempt to fill the tub, I noticed that my bath bubbles were gray and dirty. My next grievance is that for such a large bathroom, they give you only one tiny piece of soap (the size of a silver dollar), which you have to carry from the shower, to the sink, to the tub. After 6 days at this hotel, it was never refilled with a new one. While I admire the city’s commitment to conserving water, a functioning shower and a bar of soap are a must for a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel087
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel 1000 for three nights and it was definitely an experience to remember! This hotel is considered a "four star" hotel, but we both felt that it could easily be a "five star." First off, the hotel ambiance is extremelly relaxing and peaceful. It is somewhat dark inside and decorated with darker hues, but in a way that is very calming. The rooms are absolutely unbelievable. We had a king waterview and though we paid a little more for the view, the windows were huge and gave us a great view of the Sound. There were also lots of nice touches like a flat screen that is personalized during your stay, a great bed with nice linens and lots of storage space. The room was a little small, but more than adequate for us! The bathroom is to die for - I would love to have a duplicate made for my home! Secondly, the food at the hotel is wonderful - we ate at the restaurant once and had an excellent meal and they have a really nice happy hour each evening in front of the fire that we enjoyed every night we were there. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating and we were sorry to leave them at the end of our stay! We did not use the Spaah services but we did play virtual golf, which was a lot of fun - I would recommend it if you find yourself with an extra hour or so. We would return to the Hotel 1000 in a hot second - there is no where else we would stay in Seattle and we did our fair share of checking out some of the other hotels we were looking at. (Hotel Monaco, Hotel Vintage Park, Edgewater, etc.) - none even compared in our opinion. The location is also one of the best you can ask for in the city! If you get the chance and can afford it, definitely stay at this hotel - it will make your Seattle experience even better!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutey perfect time at Hotel 1000!”
Reviews.Author: forzuto13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Hotel 1000 for eleven nights while in Seattle for some govt. training. The Jackson Federal Building is conveniently located right across the street from the hotel. When I first called the guest relations rep I was told that I couldn't get the govt. rate for dates listed but the lady was able to confirm me and took also my requests for a king bed, quiet location and the infamous bathtub that fills from the ceiling. Upon check-in I was told that they were able to honor my request with a complimentary upgrade. The room was on the 12th floor and was nothing less than perfect! When I first entered I found the 40 " flat-screen HD TV (mounted on the wall) playing some relaxing classical music along with a selected program offering Renaissance art. You can play different themed programs. My favorite was the "1000 Places to Visit Before You Die." The room is nicely decorated in a subdued Asian theme, with dark floors, bamboo, blue and maroon walls. The king-sized bed was super comfortable, with nice feather pillows. The room itself was spacious and a had a large desk with lamp. The services there are extremely good. There is free long distance phone calling from the rooms and the business office. There are two computers with free internet. I was usually the only person in the room at any time. There is a really cool library located on the fourth floor that has nice comfy chairs and a fire place and you can choose the same music programs that are in each of the rooms. My friend and I went there one evening with a bottle of wine, dimmed the lights, put on the classical music, and had a very pleasant evening. There is a decent gym, although a little small in size. Still it has two elliptical trainers and treadmills. Free weights up to 50 lbs and three different fixed machines for shoulders, legs and back/triceps. There is a spa with services next to the gym and also a golfing simulator. Parking is availabe in garage and was for guests only when I was there. It can be pricey, however. The entire staff there was always very accomodating and friendly. Most are pretty young, but all very eager to assist you and always greeting you upon entering and leaving. The room service provides you with free Starbucks coffee to brew in the french presses that are in the rooms. I requested a refridgerator be brought up to my room so I could keep some food in their during my stay. What's also great is that the hotel is downtown and there are several happy hour offers nearby where you can get cheap appetizers and drinks. The hotel bar/restaurant has their own happy hour from 4-6 pm. I would always go to this place, called Contour, that was south on First Ave a block and a half. They have one of the latest happy hours around, lasting from 3 to 8 pm every day! Try the provolone cheeseburgers and lamb kebabs. Each only $1.95 at the time of my stay. Later the place become a club. The hotel is near Pier 54, where the famed Ivar's is (good for fish and chips with yummy tartar sauce!), and also close to Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square, Benaroya Symphony Hall and the Triple Door jazz club. Most things are within walking distance. Try Cafe Zum Zum for a cheap lunch. Pakistani food - various curries over basmati rice for around six bucks. We also went to Cafe Denunzio one evening. The dining room is charmingly decorated, and Tonnino, our server, was really nice. The food was pretty good but the was pretty blah. So you can see I was totally impressed with my stay at the Hotel 1000 in the Emerald City! Nothing short of perfect, actually. The cool thing about this hotel is it's size. I mean it's just big enough to have all the accomodations but also small enough to be intimate and not impersonal, like some of the big chain hotels. I highly recommend this place for anyone. Maybe not so much for big families with kids, but for sure for couples, seniors, and business people. Hope this review helps you to decide!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: rickg2007
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel 1000. We were in town for the holidays this time and this property did not disappoint. Great location in downtown if you are catching a Seahawks or Mariners game because the hotel is on the cusp of Pioneer Square. Or go a few blocks north and you're in Pike Place Market or the Piers. The front desk and valet is very attentive...very speedy response to anything we needed. Rooms are very spacious and immaculate. And we loved the restuarant and wine room that were adjacent. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will always stay here when I'm in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: katyroogal
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the H1K, it was worth every penny. Actually not expensive considering the spacious room and bath, also the high- end level of finish in the entire hotel. Elevators were always at the ready, Staff when summoned for any reason were fast, courteous and ready for any unexpected request( bed was firmer than my liking, received a new foam pad on top of mattress by bedtime). The concierge dealt with my frazzlement upon arriving from Central Time Zone at night without an opportunity for lunch or dinner due to flight issues by ushering us into the warm firelit lounge to have appetizers (gratis) and much needed cocktails. I could go on and on. The food is exquisite...be sure to try the tuna/ taro chip appetizer and the greuyere/sourdough sandwich with roasted tomato bisque soup. The Spahh called in someone early so I could get a pedicure before we left. This hotels is all about making your stay as pleasant as possible. For the first timer to Seattle it is located perfectly. A short 3-4 block walk in 3 directions will take you to most of the must see areas...Pike Place Mkt, TheAquarium, Pioneer Square (be sure to do the Underground Tour) The Seattle Art Museum is impressive with many artist of reknown, the shopping district is just a couple more blocks north and from there you can board the monorail over to the Seattle Center for even more to do. The Hotel1000 is 3 blocks from the water. I will be staying here whenever I return to Seattle. .

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Livie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at Hotel 1000 and enjoyed every minute of it. The rooms are so modern, clean and new, and I absolutely loved the design of the bathroom. The giant tub which fills from the ceiling is such a treat after trekking around Seattle in the rain and snow. We had two of the lowest grade rooms and I am extremely pleased with the value for money I got. We paid on average $214 Canadian per room per night and for the quality of room design, finishing, attention to detail and superb service, I feel it was excellent value. The hotel is centrally located on First Avenue, close by to Pike's. It is within walking distance (albeit a steep uphill climb) to the shopping district around 6th ave. The service is impeccable. From the moment you walk in, you are taken care of. It is classy and friendly, warm but very discreet and professional. The front desk is efficient and helpful The valet guys were always there to offer an umbrella for the seattle rain and always smiled to make the day more cheerful. I wished i could have stayed longer. It's my perfect idea of a weekend retreat where one can be pampered and indulge in luxury. Smooth and sexy, Hotel 1000 is one place I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A new standard in service”
Reviews.Author: wgr
Reviews.Content: Try as I might, I cannot think of anything even slightly negative to say about this hotel. From the friendly and helpful valets when we checked in, to the front desk who at noon told us our room was not ready but took all of our belongings and said they would call us on my cell when the room was ready (we happily went off to Pike Street Market and had fun while we awaited our call.) The rooms are wonderful, a good size and spacious even with two queen size beds (we were a couple, a teenager and a miniature schnauzer). The bathroom is fabulous as most people have noted. The beds and linens are deluxe. Good workout area. My wife loved the spa! Only slight disappointment was the virtual gold which just seemed bizarre, but I guess golf addicts might love it. About a block and a half from the Seattle Art Museum and about 4 blocks to the Pike Street Market. Easy walk to the pier. Lots of nice non chain shops in the area. If you stay avoid McClintock and Schmick, an awful chain! Sex shop right next door amused my 15 year old. Will be back and soon.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Catfluff
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at Hotel 1000. We had such a great time! The property is beautiful! The staff were very friendly (for the lost part - just one front desk person was not very warm and fuzzy). The doormen were great and attentive. Our room was great. Not overly spacious but we knew that when we booked. The bathroom was awesome - enjoy the tub! Enjoy a drink in the bar and take in the 'light show.' Overall, a great stay. We'd rebook here without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room!”
Reviews.Author: jeaniebeanie74
Reviews.Content: Very luxurious room. Roomy, comfortable, and the bathroom is amazing! It is worth booking this hotel just for the bathroom. Great location, will definitely come back. If you like sleek, modern hotels with luxurious appts, then this is the hotel for you. The only bad thing is that check-in is at 4pm, which is inconvenient if you have an event to prepare for that starts immediately after business hours. Also, it took a long time for the AC to start running, but I'd rank this hotel alongside the W, Sheraton, Andra, and Westin Towers in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Bustling City”
Reviews.Author: slctravelers
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and conveniently located. I loved this hotel. I also loved the continental room service breakfast for $15 that included coffee, fresh squeezed oj, two croissants, and a wonder granola yoghurt parfait topped with fresh raspberries. Room was very comfortable and quiet. I never had to wait for an elevator. I had a suite and the only thing I missed was a bathtub as hotel stays seem to be the only time I have luxury of a bath. The bathroom is spacious. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000 - a place to indulge!”
Reviews.Author: Daph04
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel 1000 was as welcoming, hip and luxurious as advertised (I discovered it via the internet). Highpoints for me were the very comfortable bed, great location, spectacular bathroom, and friendly staff. I ate at BOKA one night -- food and drinks were way better and more creative than most hotel restaurants. I'd say here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: azrael765
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 1000 Oct 7-9. We loved it. We booked it after doing lots of research, and the advice here on Trip Advisor again, paid off. We arrived very early, about 12pm ( i had emailed ahead asking if early check in was possible, not expecting anything nearly that early, they replied that they would try, but definitely hold our bags until they had our room ready) but to our surprise, they allowed us check in and showed us to our room shortly before 12:30pm. That was incredible. The room was beautiful, modern and tastefully done with cool colors and comfortable accommodations. The bathroom was gorgeous, good size, nice amenities, They had music on upon arrival which was a nice touch. The view was lovely. It was money well spent ($250/nt). The location was great. We walked all over. Pike Place Market, waterfront, even to Safeco Field and through Pioneer Square (loved it!). We ate in the hotel restaurant once, meal was terrific, reasonably priced with great service and spent one later evening at the bar. Staff was friendly and attentive. Check out was easy. I really can't say a bad word. The whole experience was smooth and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: jbail
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 is wonderful. I am currently staying here on a "girlfriends' getaway" with my former college roomate. Excellent, courteous service at every turn -- from the check-in to the restaurant and bar. For example, as we came up in the elevator from the Pike Place Market, I was carrying a bouquet that I had purchased for 5 dollars. A hotel employee was on the elevator, spotted me, and offered to find me a vase and deliver it to our room. Fabulous! The rooms are beautiful and spacious. There is free wi-fi. The fancy, ceiling-filled bathtub is spectacular, and the automatic privacy shade is a nice touch. The restaurant, BOKA, was wonderful and our host was unusually gracious. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel, and I am not an easy sell (see my review on Houston's Inn at the Ballpark).

Reviews.Title: “This is a GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: Consultantgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fabulous alternative to the standard "cookie cutter" hotel. The rooms are gorgeous and spacious. They are also beautifully decorated and appointed. The entire hotel is full of art and is wonderfully designed. Extras like a french press coffee maker, electronic blinds, tub caddy, free Internet, printer access just add to the overall great experience. Hotel staff are also wonderful. There is no choice in Seattle - STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Splurge”
Reviews.Author: WSmile5
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Oct '07. Arrived at 11:30 a.m. and our room was ready, even though was supposed to have 4 p.m. check-in time. As others note, location is terrific, and so was the view of the harbor and Olympic mtn range. Bed was great, bathroom amazing, esp. the tub! Staff extra-helpful. Room staff barged in on us 2-3 times though, they didn't knock first! Breakfast (for an extra $10-12) was worth it, at least once. Boka was pricey and extra-trendy, probably worth it though for laughs.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy!”
Reviews.Author: Terikitty
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 is a very beautiful, modern, upscale hotel in a great location in Seattle! We had a wonderful three day stay in Seattle, and we could walk to almost all of the sights we wanted to see. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, and the beds were oh so comfortable! The bathroom is very fancy and modern, and our room was extremely clean. The restaurant is somewhat expensive, but the food was very delicious. We had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: trpplnr
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located within walking distance of Pike's Place Market and Pioneer Square, clean and beautifully appointed room, exceptionally comfortable bed, friendly staff. For an extra fee, you can have a really great breakfast with unique items, such as yogurt and fruit parfaits and a selection of cheeses. They also offer eggs, cereal, rolls and muffins. The view from our waterview room was decent, but partially blocked by the building in front of the hotel. The only disappointment was that our Deluxe room did not come with the tub that everyone has been raving about in their reviews. We arrived after 2am and by the time we even noticed, we were already unpacked, ready for bed and exhausted. The room was $300 a night and we were offered $33 off per night because of the tub. Other than that, we enjoyed the hotel and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: liam.walsh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 1000, in fact I am still here. I can find fault with anything and i can here too, slightly silly shower head but thats all i can find to complain about. Its a very beautiful and incredibly appointed hotel. Its trendy without being as over the top like The W hotels can be. This hotel will is great for anybody. L

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000 was Terrific”
Reviews.Author: blazinrebel
Reviews.Content: After deciding to include Seattle as a part of my trip, I spent a LOT of time researching the different hotels there (so many!) and had a very difficult decision to make. It had a very classy atmosphere and if you're a couple or a business traveler you will feel very comfortable. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. All the rooms are ultra-modern and feature plasma televisions, complementary internet, and even a bathtub that fills from the ceiling. Their restaurant right off of the lobby is also very good and has some great deals on drinks and food too if you check them out for their reverse happy hour in the late evening. They also have a nice and small but functional business center and a fully-equipped workout center free of charge. The minibar is also fairly inexpensive. I will admit that it's not the most affordable but to be right downtown and a short walk from Pike Place, anything decent is going to be expensive. The only issue I had during the stay is how expensive and disorganized the room service was. Not only were the food prices expensive (to be expected anyway I guess), but there two different unexplained service charges on the bill also and that didn't include tax or gratuity.... I'm very used to having an automatic gratuity on the bill and I assumed that it was included in one of the service charges, however it was explained to me by the valet (which is who they have deliver the food apparently) that it is not so I also had to tip him. For a late night snack of a shrimp cocktail and a bowl of soup I think I ended up paying about $35.00 overall. The breakfast costed roughly the same and it was also somewhat disappointing. So, overall I was very pleased with the amenities, cleanliness, and luxury of Hotel 1000 and would definitely stay there again no question. Being that room service was the only part that was lacking, I just won't order it next time, not a big deal. If you are concerned with room service I guess you could stay at the larger, more expensive W Hotel but with that expect impersonal service and daily internet access fees I suppose. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “not sure if I'd stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: mgoblueCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hotel 1000 for a couple nights. When we arrived we were told our room was not ready and to come back at 4:00 p.m. when the rooms were guaranteed. We returned at 4:15 p.m. and were told our room was still unavailable. After sitting in the lobby for 30 minutes, a manager came and offered free drinks and appetizers at the bar. Because of the inconvenience we accepted the offer. Although the staff was "nice enough" we never felt like they would go the "extra mile" to accomodate our needs. We had plans to return after a trip to San Juan, but canceled and booked with another hotel that had much better customer service. We contacted the front desk a couple of times and always had to call back a second time before we got a response to our request. The rooms were beautiful and the bathroom was amazing. Still, for the price you pay, the service should be exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: zman700
Reviews.Content: Perfect!! That is what we thought about the Hotel 1000. We originally booked 2 nights at the Crowne Plaza and 2 at the Hotel 1000, but after 1 night at the Crowne(very disappointed) we called the 1000 to see if they had rooms so we could check in a day early and they did. They were cheerful and very helpful on the phone and even more so at the hotel. It was what we expect in a hotel, people that enjoy their job and are very happy to have you as their guest. From the quick check-in, at 10am, to the receptionist taking you to your room and showing the room to you, to the beautiful room and awesome tub, everything was just perfect. Location was great, we were there for an anniversary trip to see Seattle and a ballgame and the 1000 was an easy walk to the Market, Safeco Field, and Pioneer Square. As most have said, my wife and I will not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: Scottsdale_from_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our Alaskan cruise. It is a very nice hotel with nice modern rooms, great beds and bathrooms. We ate in the Boka restaurant next to the 1000 and had a great dinner. Also, their custom cocktails were an experience. This hotel is very close to downtown and the docks so it's convenient for walking or cabs. I was disappointed that the TV was not truly HD (I'm spoiled now). Also, had a couple of very minor issues with the makeup mirror and desk lamp. All in all, it was a nice stay. I would suggest it to others along with the hotel we stayed at when we returned from our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay..”
Reviews.Author: cherryRUk
Reviews.Content: This was a clean, modern ,hotel with comfortable beds,though the 2 queen beds left the room a bit on the tight side.We couldn't get a room higher than the 8th floor(apparently there are no 2 queens on the higher floors) . Our teenagers loved the novel bathroom. The staff were courteous and helpful, with the exception of one surly waiter at breakfast on our final morning. Good location, -most things in walking distance.Wouldn't object to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location great service”
Reviews.Author: tinkit
Reviews.Content: ok - like all the other posting say - th bathroom ROCKS!! Yes, we used the tub - you just have too! We ordered room service the first night as we got in at 10:30 and starving - it was quick and tasty! The decor is modern with an Asian twist - very nicely done and attractive. The location was perfect - Seattle is a very walkable city and we were able to walk to the market, pioneer square, Safeco field, resteraunts and many other places form here. Many times we would pop back into the hotel on our way to something else just to take a quick rest and set off again. Which was FAB! The service was wonderful - very friendly staff - made us reservations for dinner, showed us where to go fo glass blowing, underground tour, breakfast ect.. ect... I will definatly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great room & Good location”
Reviews.Author: Lope43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 2 nights on our way to a cruise and loved it. It has a funky boutique vibe. The room was very comfortable and our 10 year old son loved the tub! I loved the Molton Brown products and the turn down service was a nice touch too. The hotel is not kid friendly but we enjoyed it anyway. We asked the front desk for a simple dinner spot and she suggested Quiznos sub shop! I am not sure if they are used to seeing kids. We were able to walk down to Pike Street and shops and restaurants are nearby. We did not find our room dark, but the weather was bright and sunny and we had our curtains wide open. Everything in our room was in good working order. It took a minute to figure out the fancy phone though! We thought it was a good price for the property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Decor and Service”
Reviews.Author: Earlus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 1000 with my husband and 18-month old daughter while traveling on business. I had booked this hotel because of its location, but also because it advertised a bathtub that filled from the ceiling, which I knew my daughter would get a big kick out of. While it's obviously not a hotel that caters to families with small children, we had an excellent experience. The room was very well decorated, if a little masculine, and the bathroom was the best I've ever been in (in terms of size, awesome bathtub, and general design). The service was amazing--we ordered a fruit salad from room service at 10pm, and it was delivered within 15 minutes! We ate off the bar menu at the restaurant for a late lunch one day, and I was not terribly impressed--everything was very salty (maybe because it's bar food?). My only complaints: the refrigerator/bar area was very swanky and it actually looked like you could mix a cocktail or two with the supplies provided (they also had several different types of glasses available!). Anyway, the complaint is that everything in the bar and refrigerator is weight-sensitive, so it was impossible to store anything we brought with us. Second, the bottled water was not complimentary--a minor complaint, but this is a very expensive hotel, so I thought it would be a nice thing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Weak Wannabe...”
Reviews.Author: NilsStCyr
Reviews.Content: Great facility. Wannabe 1st class service but turns out very stuffy and contrived. Restaurant is absolutely dumb and forced...

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ex-LA
Reviews.Content: What a cool hote! Terrific, friendly, helpful service in the most unpleasant circumstances: The people in the room next door were having a very loud party at 3:30 AM. I called down to the front desk to complain- two minutes later, it was dead silent over there. The next morning, the manager sent me a very nice breakfast with his apologies. They also discounted my rate that night by 50%. Very nice, contemporary accommodations- dark finishes with halogen lighting, almost too dark actually. The bathrooms are as described: very cool with trademark tubs. Internet access is fast and free. Location is fairly good (especially if you want to peruse the adult bookstore next door!)- but it felt safe and was walking distance to most things (10 min uphill walk to convention center, 20-25 min uphill walk to space needle/experience music) Cool lounge and restaurant in the lobby- didn't eat there but had drinks and appetizers- very tasty. Off topic: we had a fantastic meal at the Dahlia Lounge- highly recommended for superb food, cool ambiance, and excellent wine list (96 Harlan for $350- no joke!)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: CharmCity1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 1000 for our 3 year anniversary and we were both blown away by the exceptional service and beautiful decor. Upon checking in, Katie from the front desk was kind enough to accompany us up to the room and explain the room's amenities (including the awesome tub that fills from the ceiling!) We received a lovely surprise of sparkling wine and strawberries in our corner room, and had a relaxing, quiet stay, even though the hotel is situated on a busy street. We stayed on the 8th floor and did not hear any street noise at all. The room service menu is wonderful, as well as the late night happy hour menu (10PM-midnight) at BOKA, the hotel's restaurant. During happy hour, all small plates are half price, giving us a chance to try a little of everything. The fitness center is more well equipped than most boutique hotels, and features 2 elliptical trainers and 2 treadmills (all with built in TVs), as well as a few weight machines and free weights. What really sets the Hotel 1000 apart from other high-end boutique hotels is the service. Not only are the employees attentive, but rather than being cold and arrogant, everyone there is incredibly friendly and accomodating. I'll definitely be staying at Hotel 1000 again!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: chronic_jetlag
Reviews.Content: I was really stunned by the Hotel 1000. I needed to make a fast trip to Seattle to renew my passport, and found this hotel right across the streed from the federal building. If you like an elegant, quiet, nice hotel with outstanding staff, this is the place for you. The lobby is really quite beautiful, with subdued lighting, no musack, quiet elegance, and a staff whose response to every one of my queries was "no problem." The room was a knock out with original art and sculpture, large screen plasma tv, outstanding free internet, fand ree long distance calls.The bed was superb, with goose down quilts and wonderful designer lighting. I had a deluxe room on the 10th floor, and the writing desk for work was one of the best I have ever seen in a hotel. The bathroom had top designer fixtures, a nice view over Seattle, and a tub which fills from the ceiling! The only bathroom I have seen that compares in the Okura in Tokyo or perhaps the Amangani, The breakfast buffet is really nice- thick linen table cloths, a small fire in the center of the room surrounded by Japanese river rocks. They served muffins, , proscuttiio, vanilla and banana pancakes with real maple syrup, parfaits with fresh berries, freshly squozen orange juice, hot oatmeal and all of this on a small two meter long table. The breakfast area is quiet with earth muted tones in design. The waiter even let me see the container of 100% maple syrup (I have an allergy to artifical maple flavor) so didn't have to worry.. They gave me a free extended checkout, stored my luggage for ne, sent a staff member into the street to flag down a cab to the airport, and did whatever they could to make my visit as pleasant as possible. I log about 150k air miles a year and stay at a lot of hotels around the world, particularly in Asia. Hotel 1000 is one of the nicest I have stayed at any price,. I have stayed at the Seattle Four Seasons and I think Hotel 1000 is nicer. In fact, I want to take my famly back there just to see the quiet elegant design of the Hotel 1000. The staff and the property deserve an A+ for excellence. This will definitely be my headquarters in Seattle from now on.

Reviews.Title: “A great night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: jkmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and were treated to sparkling wine and strawberries upon check in! The room was outstanding and we loved the tub that filled from the ceiling! Big enough for 2 people. The bed was really comfortable and we had a great night's sleep. We were on a corner (6th floor) and really didn't hear much traffic noise at all. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Noisy, Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: WhensTheNextFlight
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely but it is situated on a street which is the scene of car cruising. I came to Seattle to shop over the weekend and both Friday and Saturday nights I was unable to sleep until after 3:00am. This street is where you go if you want to show off how much bass your car stereo has. If your intention is to stay out and party until the bars close, this is a great place to make camp. If not, stay somewhere else - unless you like bass vibration.

Reviews.Title: “What a Place!”
Reviews.Author: travelbunnyhoney
Reviews.Content: Fabulous!!!!!!!!! The hotel was great - took another reviewer's advice and parked on the street for free (couldn't find a cheaper parking garage than the hotel and that was way expensive). Breakfast buffet in The Studio was incredible. Almost died at the price ($15) but then found out that it was about the same cost as the breakfast buffet at the Courtyard.... The Studio's was classier, more elegant and exotic for roughly the same amount of money. The room was heavenly. Staff were great. Enjoyed the spa. Couldn't figure out how to make the Starbucks coffee in some funky pot - did it all wrong and then realized there were written instructions right next to the pot. Location a little strange (downtown financial district next to an erotica shop) but within walking distance to the lively Pike Place Market. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, fabulous restaurant and golf!”
Reviews.Author: rainbow_jenny
Reviews.Content: Although I have not stayed at Hotel 1000, I feel compel to share my experience as a local Seattleite on its restaurant Boka, the Golf Club, and the amazing service from the staff. I planned a surprise evening for my husband on our wedding anniversary, beginning with a 9 hole round of "virtual golf,", then dinner at Boka in Hotel 1000. The Golf Club downstairs offers some 50 courses around the world on high tech screen, with both men and women golf clubs available for use. We arrived 20 minutes late for our tee time and had to wait another 20 minutes before the "pro" arrived. However, the staff members were very courteous and apologetic. We were given complimentary drinks while waiting . We thoroughly enjoyed playing the front 9 hole of Mauna Kea while the staff checked in on us regularly to see how we were doing. They even coordinated with Boka Restaurant to hold our reservation since we were running behind schedule. Boka is one of THE best restaurant in Seattle with FABULOUS food, served in very modern decor and chic ambiance . Every staff member along the way congratulated us on our anniversary and made the evening so incredibly memorable. The staff members at Hotel 1000 have converted us into loyal fans, and we look forward to many more dining/golfing trips and stays there.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not a fan”
Reviews.Author: JMillarLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: To paraphrase another hotel's marketing motto "I'm not a fan". The stay started out wrong with a cold and unpleasant reception. When I gently pointed out that my reservation was for a king and not two queens, reception said "I'll see what I can do, but it will cost you $50 more." How gracious. Miss Congeniality went on to warn me that, because of the hotel's sophisticated technology, if I didn't return my room key I'd be charged $20. Room and hotel was comfortable; no question. Pleasing earth tones in hallways and rooms, and plenty of ambient light from all the gizmos blinking in the rooms. Sophisticated did not translate into operative as I found out when I tried to turn on the television. Great picture; no sound. A call downstairs was unhelpful.."Just turn it on and off a couple times." I did. Silence. I gave up. On check out (gave the key back), I mentioned the TV issue and was told "Oh, yeah, that's been happening a lot". Work out the kinks, remind personnel it's all about the guests and I'll think about giving it another try.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: liketospend
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite and adjoining room for a two night stay from my wife and I and our todler. Everything about this hotel exceeded expectation. The rooms were fantastic - the bathrooms have to be seen to be believed - the service was organised and helpful - the concierge made our dinner reservations and booked a baby sitter, the check in clerk took us to our suite made sure we were comfortable and even brought us a microwave for my son's meals. This is WAY more than a 4 star hotel. 6+ in my books!
